priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Category for Clinical Observation Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C89963

self.title: CDISC SEND Category for Clinical Observation Terminology

definition: Terminology related to classifications that describe and group clinical observations.
name: Category for Clinical Observation
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Category for Clinical Observation Terminology

terms.definition: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examiner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the subject (symptom).
Of or relating to or located in the dermis. When used in the context of clinical observations, dermal may also include findings related to other components of the skin.
A medical specialty concerned with the structure and function of the eye and the medical and surgical treatment of its defects and diseases. (NCI)
A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation.
A qualitative or semi-quantitative measurement of a subject's nutritional intake.
